opportunities.request_description:
MODERN ADULT CONTEMPORARY ARTISTS or BANDS with Male or Female Vocals are needed by the Senior V.P. of A&R at a Major Record Label that's searching for Fresh, New Talent!

This A&R Executive is searching for acts that would appeal to fans of these references:

"Chemtrails Over The Country Club" by Lana Del Rey

"My Love Mine All Mine" by Mitski

"What Was I Made For?" by Billie Eilish

Please submit well-crafted Adult Contemporary Songs that could be heard on a playlist with the references! Memorable melodies, subdued rhythms, meaningful hooks, solid arrangements, and well-written lyrics are all needed for this opportunity. Modern Adult Contemporary instrumentation in the general wheelhouse of the references will work best. Please make sure any virtual sounds or samples you use are high quality, realistic, and not dated-sounding. Compelling, expressive, and well-performed vocals are the way to go!

IMPORTANT: This Executive is interested in artists and bands that have gained some traction from actively working on their careers. Please detail (in your bio) what you are doing with your career. Include any impressive touring, fan base, sales, streaming, or social media figures. That said – if you’re a new artist or band just starting out and don’t have much of a story or track record, but you DO have an amazing sound and some killer Songs to back it up, they still want to hear you!

TAXI Tip: We recommend submitting at least 2 Songs per submission so they can see if you’ve got depth in your material.

Your recording quality needs to be clean, clear, and well-balanced so that it represents your Songs well. Do NOT copy the referenced examples in any way, shape, or form. Use them only as a general guide for texture and tone.

Please submit as many Songs as you'd like, online or per CD, and please include lyrics, photos, and a bio. All submissions will be screened by a TAXI A&R Team Member who has a strong relationship with the Executive. Submissions must be received no later than 11:59 PM (PDT) on Tuesday, April 23rd, 2024. TAXI # S240423AC

SOULFUL BLUES ROCK SONGS with Male Vocals are needed for an (up to) $150, Direct-to-Film Producer placement in an upcoming Independent Feature Film that's currently in post-production!

Note: You'll get 100% of the sync fee, and keep 100% of your publishing and master rights. No publishing splits.

This Film's Producer is looking for Mid-Tempo Songs with Male Vocals that could work as a replacement for "Soulshine" by Allman Brothers, which is currently temped in:

"Soulshine" by Allman Brothers

They're NOT looking for clones or soundalikes! Similar tempo, style, and overall vibe? Yes. Clones? No!

IMPORTANT: Because the scene is already edited, matching (or being close to) the tempo of the reference is strongly recommended.

Please submit Blues Rock Songs with a hopeful vibe, soulful melodies, engaging grooves, and well-crafted lyrics. Instrumentation that's in the general wheelhouse of the reference Song will work best for this opportunity (think electric guitars, organ, drums, bass, etc.) Please ensure any virtual instruments or samples you use are high-quality and realistic. Well-performed, expressive, and soulful Male vocals are needed.

Lyrics should avoid references to specific names, places, dates, times, brands, and profanity. Please do NOT copy the referenced artist or song in any way, shape, or form. Use it as a general guide for tempo, tone, and overall vibe. Do NOT submit any material with unauthorized samples of any other artists’ music, sounds, or any other form of media. Broadcast Quality is needed.

The license fee for this placement is (up to) $150, depending on the ultimate use. This is a Direct-to-Producer placement, so you’ll keep 100% ownership of your Copyright and Master Recordings, plus you’ll also get 100% of the License Fee and any applicable performance royalties. You must own or control your Copyright and Master Recordings to pitch for this opportunity. Please submit as many Songs as you’d like, online or per CD. All submissions will be screened and critiqued by TAXI. Submissions must be received no later than 11:59 PM (PDT) on Thursday, April 25th, 2024. TAXI # S240425SH

Lots of HAPPY, KID-FRIENDLY INSTRUMENTALS and/or INSTRUMENTAL CUES are needed by a Great Music Licensing Company with lots of Film and TV placements.

This Library is looking for several Instrumentals (and/or Cues) in the general stylistic ballpark of the following references:

High Fives - CBC Kids

Stuck in the Quinceanera - Stuck in the Middle (from 10:44 to12:05)

Sweet Tooth! - DC Super Hero Girls (from 0:13 - 1:10)

Please submit well-crafted Instrumentals and/or Instrumental Cues that create an overall happy, fun, bouncy, and positive vibe and feel for kids/preteen programming, promos, and entertainment. Your submissions should have uplifting motifs, feel-good grooves, lots of emotionally upbeat energy, and excellent arrangements. Instrumentation in the general ballpark of the references will suit your submissions best – think keys, claps, vibraphone, synths, bass, drums, funky guitar, etc. Please be sure any virtual instruments or sounds you use are high-quality and not dated-sounding.

Your submissions should be roughly 1.5 minutes long for Cues, and about 2 to 4 minutes long for Instrumentals, give or take. Non-faded, buttoned/stinger endings will work best. Please do NOT copy the referenced artists or songs in any way, shape, or form. Use them only as a guide for tempo, texture, and tone. Do NOT submit any material with unauthorized samples of any other artists’ music, sounds, or any other form of media. Broadcast Quality is needed.

This company offers an EXCLUSIVE deal, so please be sure the Instrumentals and/or Cues you pitch for this opportunity are NOT already signed with any other Companies or Catalogs. Any sync fees will be split 50/50 with the Company. You'll get 100% of the Writer's share, and the Publisher will get 100% of the Publisher's share. You must own or control your Masters and Copyright to submit. Please submit as many Instrumentals and/or Cues as you'd like, online or per CD. All submissions will be screened and critiqued by TAXI. Submissions must be received no later than 11:59 PM (PDT) on Tuesday, April 23rd, 2024. TAXI # S240423HL

Lots of KID'S LULLABY INSTRUMENTALS and/or INSTRUMENTAL CUES are needed by a Great Music Licensing Company with lots of Film and TV placements.

This Library is looking for a bunch of Instrumentals (and/or Cues) in the general stylistic ballpark of the following references:

"Go to Sleep Little Baby" by TinyGrads

"William's Lullaby" by Soothing Lullabies

"Twinkle Twinkle Little Star" by Relax Bear

Please submit original and well-crafted Instrumentals and/or Instrumental Cues with a soft, soothing sound that could be used to help young children fall asleep. Your submissions should have relaxing motifs, slow-moving rhythms, solid arrangements, peaceful sounds, and a soft, gentle vibe. Instrumentation in the general ballpark of the references will suit your submissions best – think vibraphone, xylophone, soft guitar, etc. Please be sure any virtual instruments or sounds you use are high-quality and not dated-sounding.

Your submissions should be roughly 1.5 minutes long for Cues, and about 2 to 4 minutes long for Instrumentals, give or take. Non-faded, buttoned endings will work best. Please do NOT copy the referenced artists or songs in any way, shape, or form. Use them only as a guide for tempo, texture, and tone. Do NOT submit any material with unauthorized samples of any other artists’ music, sounds, or any other form of media. Broadcast Quality is needed.

This company offers an EXCLUSIVE deal, so please be sure the Instrumentals and/or Cues you pitch for this opportunity are NOT already signed with any other Companies or Catalogs. Any sync fees will be split 50/50 with the Company. You'll get 100% of the Writer's share, and the Publisher will get 100% of the Publisher's share. You must own or control your Masters and Copyright to submit. Please submit as many Instrumentals and/or Cues as you'd like, online or per CD. All submissions will be screened and critiqued by TAXI. Submissions must be received no later than 11:59 PM (PDT) on Thursday, May 2nd, 2024. TAXI # S240502BQ

VINTAGE SOUTHERN GOSPEL SONGS (in the Public Domain) with Male and/or Female Vocals are needed by a very successful EXCLUSIVE Music Library. This company has a very long history of lots and lots of really AWESOME placements, tons of which have been for TAXI members!

This Company is looking for vintage recordings of Public Domain Songs that could be heard on a playlist with the following references:

"When The Roll Is Called Up Yonder" performed by The Original Carter Family

"Leaning On The Everlasting Arm" by Early Sons Of The Pioneers

"Don't You Hear Jerusalem Moan" by Gid Tanner & The Skillet Lickers

NOTE: This Company is NOT looking for Instrumentals. Submissions need to include vocals!

IMPORTANT: This company is looking for religious Songs in the PUBLIC DOMAIN that were recorded before 1950. They DO NOT want material that was recently recorded and made to sound old. They can only use AUTHENTIC, ORIGINAL, VINTAGE RECORDINGS, and only if the sound quality is reasonably good. Please ensure that the music you submit was recorded before 1950 (give or take a few years), or this Company cannot use it!

Please submit vintage recordings of Public Domain Gospel Songs with an old-timey sound and lots of deep-south charm! Your submissions should have southern vocal deliveries with rich harmonies. Era-appropriate Broadcast Quality is needed.

Please double check to make sure the music you submit is truly in the Public Domain! Check out the Public Domain Information Project website for more info.

IMPORTANT! Per our client, your submissions must NOT be encumbered by ANY other publishing, licensing, administration, and/or exploitation deals (whether non-exclusive or exclusive) including publishing/licensing agreements with CD Baby Pro, TuneCore, etc.

This Company offers an EXCLUSIVE deal, so the material you submit for this request CANNOT be signed with other publishers or catalogs. Sync fees will be split 50/50. You must own or control your Masters to pitch for this opportunity. Please submit as many Songs as you'd like, online or per CD. All submissions will be screened and critiqued by TAXI. Submissions must be received no later than 11:59 PM (PDT) on Tuesday, April 30th, 2024. TAXI # S240430PD

Lots of COUNTRY/HIP-HOP INSTRUMENTALS and/or INSTRUMENTAL CUES are needed by a Great Music Licensing Company with lots of Film and TV placements.

This Library is looking for several Instrumentals (and/or Cues) in the general stylistic ballpark of the following references:

WARNING: The references may include graphic and explicit lyrics. Listener discretion is advised.

"TYRANT" by Beyoncé & Dolly Parton 

"Buckle Bunny" by Tanner Adell

"SWEET ★ HONEY ★ BUCKIIN'" by Beyoncé

Please submit well-crafted Country/Hip-Hop Instrumental Cues that combine traditional Country motifs with modern Hip-Hop energy! Your submissions should have distinctly Country motifs mixed with Hip-Hop beats and modern production techniques. Your arrangements should be solid, stick to a central motif throughout, and add/subtract layers of instrumentation as your Cues progress to create a forward motion. Country/Hip-Hop instrumentation that's in the general wheelhouse of the references will work best. Please make sure that any virtual instruments you use are high-quality and genre-appropriate.

Your submissions should be roughly 1.5 minutes long for Cues, and about 2 to 4 minutes long for Instrumentals, give or take. Non-faded, buttoned/stinger endings will work best. Please do NOT copy the referenced artists or songs in any way, shape, or form. Use them only as a guide for tempo, texture, and tone. Do NOT submit any material with unauthorized samples of any other artists’ music, sounds, or any other form of media. Broadcast Quality is needed.

This company offers an EXCLUSIVE deal, so please be sure the Instrumentals and/or Cues you pitch for this opportunity are NOT already signed with any other Companies or Catalogs. Any sync fees will be split 50/50 with the Company. You'll get 100% of the Writer's share, and the Publisher will get 100% of the Publisher's share. You must own or control your Masters and Copyright to submit. Please submit as many Instrumentals and/or Cues as you'd like, online or per CD. NO DEADLINE EXTENSIONS for this request. Sorry folks, but we're on an extremely tight deadline, so please don't ask! All submissions will be screened and critiqued by TAXI. Submissions must be received no later than 11:59 PM (PDT) on Thursday, April 18th, 2024. TAXI # S240418RY

TRADITIONAL COUNTRY SONGS with Male Vocals are needed for an (up to) $150, Direct-to-Film Producer placement in an upcoming Independent Feature Film that's currently in post-production!

Note: You'll get 100% of the sync fee, and keep 100% of your publishing and master rights. No publishing splits.

This Producer is looking for Songs with Male vocals that could work as a replacement for "Crazy" by Willie Nelson, which is currently temped in:

"Crazy" by Willie Nelson

They're NOT looking for clones or soundalikes! Similar tempo, style, and overall vibe? Yes. Clones? No!

VERY IMPORTANT: Because the scene is already edited, matching (or being close to) the tempo of the reference is strongly recommended.

Please submit Traditional Country Songs with a throwback sound and an emotive, vulnerable vibe! Your submissions should have great musicianship, touching and heartfelt hooks, down-tempo rhythms, and well-crafted lyrics. Instrumentation that's in the general wheelhouse of the reference Song will work best for this opportunity (think acoustic guitar, steel guitars, drums, upright bass, etc). Please ensure your productions are genre-appropriate and any virtual instruments or samples you use are high-quality. Well-performed Male vocals are the way to go for this request.

Lyrics should avoid references to specific names, places, dates, times, brands, and profanity. Please do NOT copy the referenced artist or song in any way, shape, or form. Use it as a general guide for tempo, tone, and overall vibe. Do NOT submit any material with unauthorized samples of any other artists’ music, sounds, or any other form of media. Broadcast Quality is needed.

The license fee for this placement is (up to) $150, depending on the ultimate use. This is a Direct-to-Film Producer placement, so you’ll keep 100% ownership of your Copyright and Master Recordings, plus you’ll also get 100% of the License Fee and any applicable performance royalties. You must own or control your Copyright and Master Recordings to pitch for this opportunity. Please submit as many Songs as you’d like, online or per CD. All submissions will be screened and critiqued by TAXI. Submissions must be received no later than 11:59 PM (PDT) on Saturday, April 20th, 2024. TAXI # S240420CY

Lots of GENRE-BENDING COUNTRY SONGS with FEMALE vocals are needed by a Great Music Licensing Company with lots of Film and TV placements.

This Library is looking for Songs that would fit well on a playlist with the following references:

"TEXAS HOLD 'EM" by Beyoncé

"Buckle Bunny" by Tanner Adell

"SWEET ★ HONEY ★ BUCKIIN'" by Beyoncé

Please submit original Country Songs that effectively blur the lines between Country, Hip-Hop, Soul, and Pop! Your submissions should have genre-bending elements such as Country motifs mixed with Pop/Hip-Hop rhythms, soulful vocal deliveries mixed with modern production techniques, etc. Regardless of the approach you take, your track should have solid arrangements, catchy melodies, and well-crafted lyrics. Country, Soul, Hip-Hop, and Pop instrumentation in the general wheelhouse of the reference Songs will work best. Please make sure that any virtual instruments or samples you use are high-quality. Well-performed and confident Female vocals could help you seal the deal.

Lyrics should avoid references to specific names, dates, times, places, brands, and profanity. Please do NOT copy the referenced artists or songs in any way, shape, or form. Use them only as a guide for tempo, texture, and tone. Do NOT submit any material with unauthorized samples of any other artists’ music, sounds, or any other form of media. Broadcast Quality is needed.

This company offers an EXCLUSIVE deal, so please be sure the Songs you pitch for this opportunity are NOT already signed with any other Companies or Catalogs. Any sync fees will be split 50/50 with the Company. You'll get 100% of the Writer's share, and the Publisher will get 100% of the Publisher's share. You must own or control your Masters and Copyright to submit. Please submit as many Songs as you'd like, online or per CD. NO DEADLINE EXTENSIONS for this request. Sorry folks, but we're on an extremely tight deadline, so please don't ask! All submissions will be screened and critiqued by TAXI. Submissions must be received no later than 11:59 PM (PDT) on Sunday, April 21st, 2024. TAXI # S240417CG

HIT-WORTHY COUNTRY SONGS with Male Vocals are needed by a world-renowned Publisher for a rising Country Star looking for new material!

This Publisher is on the hunt for slam-dunk Hits in All Tempos that could be heard on a playlist with the following references:

"This Heart" by Corey Kent

"Holy Smokes" by Bailey Zimmerman

"Spin You Around (1/24)" by Morgan Wallen

Please submit Country Songs with lots of Top-40 appeal, down-home charm, and the potential to be the next chart-topping Country hit! Your submissions should have unforgettable choruses, catchy melodies, engaging rhythms, and well-written lyrics that are honest and relatable. Instrumentation and arrangements may vary between traditional Country, modern Country, or even powerful ballads with a Pop/Country feel. Whichever approach you take, make sure your submissions are rooted firmly in the Country genre and are consistent and competitive with other Songs in your chosen style or sub-genre. Expressive and compelling Male vocal performances are needed!

TAXI Tip: Vocal deliveries can often make or break Song pitches. Make sure that the vocals in your Songs are well-performed, compelling, and rich with Country authenticity if you want to get this Artist and Label excited about your Songs!

Stripped-down demos and full productions are both okay to submit, as long as your Songs are great and your recordings are clean, clear, and well-balanced! Do NOT copy the references in any way, shape, or form. Use them only as a general guide for tempo, tone, texture, and overall vibe.

NOTEWORTHY: If time permits, someone from the Publisher's staff (who has been trained as a TAXI screener) will screen for this request. That means that somebody who is directly involved in this request could be "ears-on" with your submissions.

The specific deal points will be negotiated on a Song-by-Song basis directly with the Publisher. Please submit as many Songs as you like, online or per CD, and PLEASE include lyrics! Submissions must be received no later than 11:59 PM (PDT) on Sunday, April 28th, 2024. TAXI # S240428NT

ORIGINAL, HIT-WORTHY COUNTRY SONGS (with some 90s influence) and Male Vocals are needed by a legendary Music Row Publisher for an award-winning Country Star working on his next release!

NOTE: This client is a CMA "Publisher of the Year" Award-winner who has had multiple million-selling singles and #1 hits with major artists, including many current cuts! This is a great opportunity to get your music heard by a highly respected Music Row Publisher!

This Client is looking for Songs in the general ballpark of the references below:

"Heartache Medication" by Jon Pardi

"Forever After All" by Luke Combs

"Lady" by Brett Young

"Tequila Little Time" by Jon Pardi

Quoting The Client: "We are looking for Songs with strong hooks and good, solid ideas that might even have a twist. They need to be strong singles with a '90s-style approach but with modern melodies. The chorus needs to really stand out and make the listener want to sing along."

Please submit original Country Songs with lots of mainstream appeal and plenty of chart-topping potential! Your submissions should have super memorable choruses, catchy melodies, engaging rhythms, and well-crafted lyrics. Modern Country instrumentation that's in the general stylistic ballpark of the references will work best for this pitch (crossover or pop-inspired instrumentation won't work here). Charismatic and well-executed vocal performances could be just what it takes to get this publisher excited about your Songs!

TAXI Tip: Although this Publisher is looking for '90s-influenced Songs, they don't want dated-sounding material! They're looking for modern Songs that have a '90s vibe. Listen closely to the references to hear what we mean by that, but don't copy them in any way, shape, or form.

Stripped-down demos and full productions are both okay to submit as long as your Songs are great, and your recordings are clean, clear, and well-balanced! Do NOT copy the references in any way, shape, or form. Use them only as a general guide for tempo, tone, texture, and overall vibe.

The specific deal points will be negotiated on a Song-by-Song basis directly by the Publisher. Please submit as many Songs as you like, online or per CD, and PLEASE include lyrics! Time-permitting, the Publisher (who has been trained as a TAXI Screener) may screen some or all of the submissions! NO DEADLINE EXTENSIONS for this request. Sorry folks, but we're on an extremely tight deadline, so please don't ask! Submissions must be received no later than 11:59 PM (PDT) on Tuesday, April 30th, 2024. TAXI # S240430VF

HIT-WORTHY MODERN COUNTRY SONGS with Male Vocals are needed by a well-connected Music Row Publisher with an impressive track record.

This Publisher is looking for chart-worthy Songs in All Tempos in the general stylistic wheelhouse of the following examples that we got directly from them:

"Thinkin’ Bout Me" by Morgan Wallen

"Where the Wild Things Are" by Luke Combs

"Cowgirls" by Morgan Wallen ft. ERNEST

Please submit modern Country Songs with tons of commercial appeal and lots of Top-40 potential! Super catchy hooks, memorable melodies, engaging rhythms, solid arrangements, and well-crafted lyrics are all needed for this opportunity. Modern Country instrumentation in the general ballpark of the references will work best. Please ensure any virtual instruments or samples you use are high quality and not dated-sounding. Confident and well-performed Male vocals could help you seal the deal!

IMPORTANT NOTE: This Publisher is specifically looking for Songs for Male Artists that fall on the edgier side of Country music! Submissions that push the boundaries a bit, but still maintain plenty of commercial appeal could potentially get this Publisher's attention! Give a good listen to the referenced artists, to see what we mean!

Stripped-down demos and full productions are both okay to submit, as long as your Songs are great and your recordings are clean, clear, and well-balanced! Do NOT copy the references in any way, shape, or form. Use them only as a general guide for tempo, tone, texture, and overall vibe.

NOTEWORTHY: If time permits, someone from the Publisher's staff on Music Row (who has been trained as a TAXI screener) will screen the submissions for this request. That means that somebody who is directly involved in this request could be "ears-on" with your submissions.

The specific deal points will be negotiated on a Song-by-Song basis directly with the Publisher. Please submit as many Songs as you like, online or per CD, and PLEASE include lyrics! Submissions must be received no later than 11:59 PM (PDT) on Monday, May 6th, 2024. TAXI # S240506MC

HARD-HITTING HYBRID HIP-HOP/EDM INSTRUMENTALS are needed by a successful International Music Library with an impressive track record of great placements in TV, Film, and Commercials!

This Library is on the hunt for Mid-to-Up-Tempo Instrumentals in the general stylistic wheelhouse of the following examples we got directly from our contact at the Company:

GoPro Awards: Million Dollar Challenge | HERO11 Black + Mini

GoPro Awards: Million Dollar Challenge | HERO8 Black + MAX

GoPro Awards: Million Dollar Challenge | HERO9 Black

Quoting the Client: "These tracks need big dynamic ranges, with great edit points and drops (ideal for epic moments). The dynamics are key."

Please submit well-crafted Hybrid Hip-Hop/EDM Instrumentals that are exploding with epic, bombastic energy! Exciting builds, sweeping risers, hard-hitting drops, modern EDM production techniques, exciting motifs, and excellent arrangements with plenty of forward motion, dynamics, and interest are all needed for this request. Modern EDM and Hip-Hop instrumentation (mixed with some sound design) will work best here. Your production and any virtual sounds or samples you use need to be high-quality and current-sounding. If you are a producer with the production chops to create this style of track, show us what you got!

Submissions should be about 2.5 minutes long, give or take. Non-faded, Buttoned/Stinger endings are needed for this pitch. Do NOT copy the referenced material in any way, shape, or form. Use them only as a guide for tempo, tone, and overall vibe. Do NOT submit any material with unauthorized samples of any other artists’ music, sounds, or any other form of media. Broadcast Quality is needed.

IMPORTANT NOTE: This Library will need 30-second and 60-second versions of your Instrumentals AS WELL AS stems, but not yet! All you need to submit for now are the Full Instrumentals, but please have 30-second and 60-second versions, AND stems on hand ready to go. Read the next paragraph carefully...

Critical FYI: The 30-second and 60-second versions are likely to be used for advertising, so they actually need to end at :29.5 seconds and :59.5 seconds, including reverb tails and instrument ring outs. TV and radio stations use computers to switch from one thing to another on VERY precise schedules, so if your reverb tails or instrument ring outs exceed :29.5 seconds and/or :59.5 seconds, your music will not work, and cannot be used.

This Company offers an EXCLUSIVE deal, so the material you submit for this request CANNOT be signed with other publishers or catalogs. If you've checked the box to have your music "monetized," published, or administrated by a company like CDBaby, TuneCore, or SongTrust, you CAN NOT submit for this request. They are fine companies, and if you're only using them to distribute your music, no problem. But, if you checked that box, you've already got a publisher or a company administrating your publishing, which means that you cannot sign that music to another publisher!

This Music Library will get 100% of the Publisher’s share, and you’ll keep 100% of the Writer’s share. You must own or control your Copyright and Master Recording to pitch for this opportunity. Please submit as many Instrumentals as you’d like, online or per CD. All submissions will be screened and critiqued by TAXI. Submissions must be received no later than 11:59 PM (PDT) on Thursday, April 25th, 2024. TAXI # S240425HH

Lots of FEEL-GOOD EDM/HOUSE INSTRUMENTAL CUES are needed by the CEO of an internationally distributed Music Licensing Company that's recently landed some really high-end placements for TAXI members.

This company's CEO is looking for quite a few Instrumental Cues in the general stylistic ballpark of the examples below:

"Crossroads" by David Bulla

"Let’s Go Home" by Eklo (Erlando Remix)

"Younger" by Seinabo Sey (Kygo Remix)

Although some of the references have vocals, please submit Instrumental Cues only. Vocal FX/chops are ok.

Please submit well-crafted EDM/House Instrumental Cues full of uplifting, positive energy! Your submissions should have catchy, feel-good motifs, grooving rhythms, and dynamic arrangements with plenty of forward motion throughout. Modern EDM instrumentation and production that's in the general stylistic wheelhouse of the reference tracks will work best. Please be sure your productions and any virtual instruments or samples you use are high quality and not dated-sounding.

Your submissions should be about 1.5 to 2 minutes long, give or take. Non-faded, buttoned/stinger endings will work best. Do NOT copy the referenced material in any way, shape, or form. Use it only as a general guide for tempo, tone, and overall vibe. Do NOT submit any material with unauthorized samples of any other artists’ music, sounds, or any other form of media. Broadcast Quality is needed.

This Company offers an EXCLUSIVE deal, so the material you submit for this request CANNOT be signed with other publishers or catalogs. Sync fees will be split 50/50. The Publisher will get 100% of the Publisher’s share, and you’ll keep 100% of the Writer’s share. You must own or control your Master and Copyright to pitch for this opportunity. Please submit as many Instrumental Cues as you’d like, online or per CD. All submissions will be screened and critiqued by TAXI. Submissions must be received no later than 11:59 PM (PDT) on Sunday, April 28th, 2024. TAXI # S240428SV

EASYGOING COUNTRY SONGS with Male or Female Vocals are needed for an (up to) $1,000, Direct-to-Film Producer placement in an upcoming Independent Feature Film with an Award Winning Indie Film Director!

Important Note: You'll get 100% of the sync fee, and keep 100% of your publishing and master rights. No publishing splits!

This Film's Producer is on the hunt for Songs that could work as a replacement for "People Are Crazy" by Billy Currington, which is currently temped in:

"People Are Crazy" by Billy Currington

They're NOT looking for clones or soundalikes! Similar tempo, style, and overall vibe? Yes. Clones? No!

QUOTING THE FILM'S PRODUCER: "We need something that could be playing on a jukebox in small-town bar."

Tempo Matters: Because the scene is already edited, matching (or being close to) the tempo of the reference is strongly recommended.

Please submit easygoing Country Songs with a light-hearted, optimistic sound and lots of Country charm! Memorable melodies, solid arrangements, engaging rhythms, and well-performed vocals are all needed for this request. Country instrumentation in the general stylistic wheelhouse of the reference will suit your submissions best (think acoustic guitar, steel guitar, bass, drums, etc.). Please ensure any virtual instruments or samples you use are high-quality and realistic. Expressive and charismatic vocal performances could help you seal the deal!

Lyrics that avoid references to specific names, dates, times, places, brands, and profanity could make your Songs easier to place. Please do NOT copy the referenced artist or song in any way, shape, or form. Use it as a general guide for tempo, tone, and overall vibe. Do NOT submit any material with unauthorized samples of any other artists’ music, sounds, or any other form of media. Broadcast Quality is needed.

The license fee for this placement is (up to) $1,000, depending on the ultimate use. This is a Direct-to-Film Producer placement, so you’ll keep 100% ownership of your Copyright and Master Recordings, plus you’ll also get 100% of the License Fee and any applicable performance royalties. You must own or control your Copyright and Master Recordings to pitch for this opportunity. Please submit as many Songs as you’d like, online or per CD. All submissions will be screened and critiqued by TAXI. Submissions must be received no later than 11:59 PM (PDT) on Tuesday, April 30th, 2024. TAXI # S240430CY

DRIVING INDIE/ROCK SONGS with Male Vocals are needed for an (up to) $150, Direct-to-Film Producer placement in an upcoming Independent Feature Film that's currently in post-production!

"Basarabye" by Itzhak Perlman

"Yidl Mitn Fidl" by Zalmen Mlotek ft. Eleanor Reissa

Please submit well-crafted Klezmer Songs with infectious rhythms, stellar musicianship, and tons of Klezmer charm (think Fiddler on the Roof-style). Your submissions should have authentic melodies, danceable rhythms, solid arrangements, and well-crafted lyrics in Yiddish. Instrumentation should be in the general stylistic wheelhouse of traditional Klezmer music, with instruments such as Accordion, Acoustic Guitar, Nylon String Guitar, Bass Guitar, Hand Percussion, Tambourine, Strings, Concert Flute, Cimbalom (Dulcimer), Orchestral Harp, Trumpet, Piano, and Drumset. Performances should feel authentic – complete with traditional Klezmer articulations (bending the notes, forcing the breath, breathing into the notes, legato, staccato, etc.).

If you're using any virtual instruments, be sure they're super high-quality and realistic sounding. This request is all about capturing an authentic Klezmer vibe and sound!

TAXI Tip: Your submissions don't need to be in one rigid tempo throughout. Historically, Klezmer music was meant for dancing, so tempos were fluid – often players slightly led or trailed the beat creating a lilting sound. Because of this, it'd actually probably be a good idea to let the rhythms of your pieces flow freely in a rubato style so they feel more authentic. The more your pieces feel like they're being performed by a real Klezmer band, the better!

Lyrics need to be in Yiddish and should avoid references to specific names, dates, times, places, brands, and profanity. Non-faded, buttoned/stinger endings are strongly recommended. "Freilach" by Klezmer Festival Band

Please submit well-crafted Klezmer Instrumentals with infectious rhythms, stellar musicianship, and tons of Klezmer charm (think Fiddler on the Roof-style). Your submissions should have authentic melodies, excellent musicianship, danceable rhythms, and solid arrangements with plenty of forward motion and interest. Instrumentation should be in the general stylistic wheelhouse of traditional Klezmer music, with instruments such as Accordion, Acoustic Guitar, Nylon String Guitar, Bass Guitar, Hand Percussion, Tambourine, Strings, Concert Flute, Cimbalom (Dulcimer), Orchestral Harp, Trumpet, Piano, and Drumset.  Performances should feel authentic – complete with traditional Klezmer articulations (bending the notes, forcing the breath, breathing into the notes, legato, staccato, etc.).

If you're using any virtual instruments, be sure they're super high-quality and realistic sounding. This request is all about capturing an authentic Klezmer vibe and sound!

TAXI Tip: Your submissions don't need to be in one rigid tempo throughout. Historically, Klezmer music was meant for dancing, so tempos were fluid – often players slightly led or trailed the beat creating a lilting sound. Because of this, it'd actually probably be a good idea to let the rhythms of your pieces flow freely in a rubato style so they feel more authentic. The more your pieces feel like they're being performed by a real Klezmer band, the better!

All submissions should be about 2 to 4 minutes long, give or take. Non-faded, buttoned endings are strongly recommended. Do NOT copy the reference tracks in any way, shape, or form. opportunities.name: Seeking Hits for Licensing Placements
opportunities.request_description:
Seeking Hits for Licensing PlacementsWe have been working tirelessly over the years to build the best catalog of great independent music from various genres. However, there is one area in which we feel we could do better. Therefor, we are seeking Pop music to represent for licensing in films, TV shows and ad campaigns. By “Pop” we are referring more to the broad appeal of the music than the genre. As long as the song has hit potential, we would like to hear it. Genre wise we are open, but indie pop and indie folk seem to work best for licensing placements. 

Here are some great examples of music that we would like to have in our catalog: 

- The Lumineers - Ho Hey
- Edward Sharpe & The Magnetic Zeros - Home
- Charli XCX - Break The Rules
- James Bay - Hold Back The River

We accept ONE-STOP submissions only, ie songs that you own or control 100% (writer, master and publisher). Please submit only professionally recorded and mastered songs. NO DEMOS, NO COVERS.

As an added bonus, if your song is Selected, we will offer to release your music on Filter Label. The songs by our talented artists can be heard in The OA, Exatlon, The Matrix Revisited, CSI: Las Vegas, Nikita, on ads for McDonald's, Nestle Wagner, Nike, Philip Morris, Hachette Filipacchi, in shows on MTV, CNN, Bravo, Nat Geo, NBC, Esquire, Channel 4 and almost every major TV network in the world.- Emil Hadji -Panzov Founder / CEO - Filter Label

opportunities.name: Fun, Feel Good Pop Songs for streaming series
opportunities.request_description:
Fun, Feel Good Pop Songs for streaming seriesWe are in need of your most fun, feel good pop song for a streaming series' next season!  Don't hold back...give us all the fun!  Can be vocal or instrumental, but needs to be current-sounding and feel like the best day ever!!

If we think your submission may fit, we will place it on hold for further review by the entire team working on this project.  If it is selected, we will contact you further with details.

Please keep in mind that this is a “submission-only” dropbox.  We are looking for the perfect song for this pitch.  We will not be giving detailed feedback on submissions.  Either we feel the song may fit the brief or it doesn’t.  We apologize for not being able to give feedback beyond whether it fits or not, but the time constraints of the nature of these projects will not allow us the time to give in-depth feedback on the song.  We will, however, submit ratings on every submission.Incorporated Elements is a company that works with songwriters, artists, producers, and DJ's to help them perfect their craft and fully realize the potential in their art. We work in the areas of production, publishing, film/TV licensing, artist development.- Ric Robbins / Incorporated Elements

opportunities.name: Beats needed for TV & Online Advertising Campaigns in South Korea ($500-$14,000 per use)
opportunities.request_description:
All rights TV & Online Advertising Campaigns in South Korea ($500-$14,000 per use)Currently seeking “beats” for use in TV & Online advertising campaigns in South Korea! 
,br>  
When I say “beats”, I mean any tracks that are driven by a breakbeat, as one, if not the most dominant part of the track. Ie, Drum & Bass, Hip-Hop, Dubstep, Electronica, Edm, Trap, Grime, Experimental etc. 
  
All tracks must be upbeat and have a “Phat Beat”, “Killer Beat”, “Sick Beats”, “Dope Beat” or whatever your preferred description would be. 
   
Music must be well produced, high-quality, mixed and mastered. Instrumental tracks preferred please, but great vocal tracks can be accepted too (if you can supply instrumental versions even better) and all tempos considered. 
  
Artists must own all rights to their music 100% on both sides and there must be no copyright infringement. All music will be listened to, reviewed and feedback given.  
  
The average cost of TV advertising commercial in Korea is $800 to $1,500 per track, and for worldwide rights up to $14,000. 
   
The average cost of Online & YouTube advertising in Korea is $500-$2500 (geo restricted for single country of Korea), and worldwide use for $3000-$5000.  
  
Selected tracks be sent to clients in South Korea and music licensed on a non-exclusive basis (so you maintain all rights to your music), we simply go 50-50 on deals we get and you're paid quarterly.   
 
The South Korean market is built on a unique structure, which is not the same as any foreign market structure around the world. Because of this Korea has a higher advertising music fee than most other countries. This may be due to systemic limitations that the performing royalties cannot be collected, but also because there is no subsequent secondary payment after the initial payment of music fees. The total amount paid in Korea is 100% mechanical payout. 
  
Clients who will be using music in South Korea; Korea's major advertising agencies including the CHEIL and INOCEAN and brands such as; Samsung, LG, Hyundai and SK to name a few. 
  
If you make “beats’ I really look forward to hearing from you ! 
  
All the best,  
- Giles Gale -
Music supervisor, sync & Licensing Manager - Resonant Music Licensing

opportunities.name: Seeking song submissions for top male and female J-Pop artists

Seeking song submissions for top male and female J-Pop artistsAudity Music, LLC is seeking strong pop and R&B-leaning music for the J-Pop music market. Japanese is the second largest music market in the world, and not far behind America in terms of annual revenue. It is a unique and complex market that Audity has been able to explore thanks to our having been on the ground living there and in neighboring Korea. Audity has close relationships with the major record labels and music publishers in Japan, including AVEX, Sony, Fuji Pacific, and others. We receive high value and not easily accessible leads in the Japanese market and have direct access to top A&Rs and decision-makers. If we like your song(s), they will make it to the right hands.

We are pitching music currently for major projects in Japan. We offer prime access to these opportunities for our writers and producers as well as co-write opportunities with writers and producers with previous and current success in the J-pop market. Also, for the right writers/producers with the right credentials and talent, we have access to the largest J-Pop camp in the world which takes place in Sweden. We are looking to hear the best of the best in pop music. And, we are looking to hear your grasp of the J-Pop sound, which many Western writers find difficult to achieve. If you have undeniable Western pop music, it can be adapted for the J-Pop market. So, please just send your best! If we like it, we can discuss next steps and also help you develop your "J-Pop ear".

Note: Although this DropBox will remain open for a while, we have  song leads monthly, so do not hesitate to submit through Music Xray. Please do not contact Audity Music directly. 

Audity Music, LLC is a progressive and forward-thinking songwriting/production, music publishing, music management and music consulting company. We currently operate out of Los Angeles, California, Tokyo, Japan, and Seoul, South Korea.

If you possess vintage recordings resonating with the essence of the following references, you might just have what we need:

 

"Dead Flowers" by Townes Van Zandt

"Wildflowers" by Tom Petty

"Nothin'" by Townes Van Zandt

We don't expect modern broadcast quality; you're welcome to submit old masters or demos. Craft original Singer/Songwriter Songs with enchanting melodies, memorable choruses, and heartfelt, genuine lyrics reflecting a Country and/or Americana influence. Exceptional vocal delivery and genre-appropriate musicianship are paramount.

 

Please ensure that your songs were recorded BEFORE 1999; otherwise, they won't align with our requirements. We're not interested in recent recordings artificially aged to sound old. Authentic, original, vintage recordings are what we seek, provided the sound quality is reasonably good.

 

Your name should be on the copyright, and submissions must consist of original compositions (no covers). Ownership or control over the Copyright and Master recordings is mandatory for submission. Avoid submitting on behalf of others. Feel free to submit multiple Songs.

 

Broadcast Quality is needed.

 

This Company does both EXCLUSIVE and NON-EXCLUSIVE deals, and they will be offered on a case-by-case basis. You must own or control your Master and Copyright to pitch for this opportunity. All submissions will be screened and critiqued by our SPP team for quality purposes, then moved forward. If they decide to move forward we will contact you immediately. If you don't hear back within a week of the deadline then you can consider it a pass. 

 

Best of luck! 
Submission deadline: Midnight April 21, 2024

new
              Sync Opp: Campaign for the Secret Boutique Whiskey.
opportunities.request_description:
Brief Description: Sync Opp: Campaign for the Secret Boutique Whiskey.
 
We have a client looking for a track for a prestigious European Boutique Whiskey brand. (Identity undisclosed)

Creative Details from Client

 

Project Overview:

Develop a captivating campaign for the secret Boutique Whiskey, set to launch this year. The campaign emphasizes fearless creativity, aiming to resonate with audiences through compelling storytelling.

Music Requirement:

The selected track should exude an indie rock vibe akin to "Welcome to my Island," featuring a strong beat and uplifting vocals. The overall tone should channel the spirit of artists like Karen O and Caroline, with a distinct "left of the dial" appeal. The lyrics must strike a balance between relevance and neutrality, avoiding overly celebratory or melancholic themes. The emphasis lies on impactful vocals and a dynamic progression that complements the video narrative.

Client Preferences:

Preferably vocals-driven, with lyrics that resonate without veering into clichéd or overly empowering territory. The song should possess a certain edge while maintaining a universal appeal.


Exclusivity and Usage:

Exclusivity is granted to similar brands within the whiskey industry. The global campaign spans across various mediums, including social media, CTV/digital platforms (limited to the US and UK), and Out-of-Home advertising. Usage rights extend for one year across all channels, with paid media usage restricted to six months in the US, UK, and Sweden.

Budget:

Total budget allocation stands at $30,000 All-In (Less all Fees), covering all aspects of music acquisition and licensing.

Additional Notes:

Creativity and relevance are paramount in song selection, aligning closely with the brand's ethos and the campaign's overarching theme of fearless innovation.

Please include lyrics, Composer (PRO/IPI)

Broadcast Quality is needed.

You must own or control your Master and Copyright to pitch for this opportunity. All submissions will be screened and critiqued by our MMG team for quality purposes, then moved forward. If they decide to move forward we will contact you immediately. If you don't hear back within a week of the deadline then you can consider it a pass.

GOOD LUCK!
Deadline: Midnight April 26, 2024,

opportunities.name: Is your career ready for the next big step? Get a one-hour phone consultation & coaching session with Steve Tramposch, Platinum A&R, Manager, & Producer
opportunities.request_description:
Is your career ready for the next big step? 



If you're looking to get signed and become famous (or even just improve your game), then you owe it to yourself to stop what you're doing right now.



Steve Tramposch has been a Senior A&R exec for some of the world’s largest record and music companies, including Capitol, Virgin, Elektra, Eleven Seven, Billboard, and more.



He’s been doing this for over 20 years, and in that time, he’s been instrumental in the early discovery of artists that have sold tens of millions of records. Rock, Pop, Alternative, Rap, R&B, Singer-Songwriter, Country, Indie, you name it.


He was responsible for signing Nothing More, Red Jumpsuit Apparatus, The Format, and many, many more, and you can be next.


Forget blindly sending in music, waiting on long audition lines, or companies that promise they’ll send it to someone like Steve if they think you’re good enough.



Steve’s going to personally consult with you and give you the FAST TRACK ROUTE to achieving your dreams.



On any given day Steve is working with any number of artists and companies, fielding offers in a large number of different capacities – record, publishing, TV/film, tours, endorsements, you name it.



When you submit your music, send as much information as possible including links to social profiles, lyrics, social stats, touring stats, etc. 



Thanks for visiting, click "Submit to this Opportunity" and let's get started. 



Hope to hear from you, see you inside.

Music must be original, well produced, mixed and mastered. Instrumental music preferred please, but great vocals welcome (but please make sure you can supply instrumental version as well) and all tempos, required.  

Additionally, covers of old classics such as Silent Night which are copyright free would be great too!

Artists must own all rights to their music 100% and there must be no copyright infringement.  

Selected tracks will be pro-actively pitched to our clients for relevant sync opportunities for use in their Christmas campaigns. Clients are film & video production companies, advertising agencies and a few game developers that make high-end content. 

Music used by clients will be licensed on a non-exclusive basis (so you maintain all rights to your music), simply go 50-50 on deals we get for you, you’re paid quarterly and keep 100% of all royalties generated from placements. Artist's will receive between £100-£10,000 per use depending on use, type of project etc, so, if you have any great Christmas music for sync, I’d really love to hear from you! 

NB; If you have already submitted and had music accepted into our catalogue that is suitable for this brief, you don’t need to re-submit as your music will automatically be pitched to our clients. Thanks! 

Looking forward to hearing and working with you :) 
 
All the best, 
Giles Gale 
Music Supervisor

Deal Type: Catalog Inclusion
Decision Maker: I'm the final decision maker
Deal Structure: Exclusive
Compensation: $25,000 - $50,000
Song Quality: Fully mastered, Broadcast ready
Similar Sounding Artists: Black Keys, Jack White, Hanni El Khatib, Whitestripes 

Why the higher than average submission fee?
Often we hear music that doesn’t make the final cut for a particular opportunity but we go ahead and select the song anyway because we believe the song is appropriate for other opportunities we’re working on. Here at Music of The Sea, we fill dozens of sync requests every week. We don’t have time to listen to everything so the higher submission fee tends to discourage all but the best - and we sign a lot of music and we place almost all of it. 

We only offer one deal and the terms are the same for everyone, so don’t submit if you’re seeking another type of deal. If we select your song, you give us exclusive rights to the song for 5 years. If after 5 years we haven’t licensed your song, the rights revert back to you. If we do license your song, we share in the revenue. Often, if we love the song we hear and want to work with you we will also have interest in hearing other songs in your catalog and possibly doing a broader deal.

opportunities.name: Composer/producer collaboration
opportunities.request_description:
Composer/producer collaborationWe are looking for professional composer/producer to collaborate in music production. This would not be a single deal, but a catalog deal, once your production is selected. 

Please submit to this opportunity only if you have a certain catalog to offer, not a single song. For our consideration – please submit your best track. 

If we select you, it means that your production will be placed in the production library Baltic Countries (Lithuania, Latvia, Estonia) for possible placements in Television shows, documentaries, news/sports feeds, etc. We offer non-exclusive publishing agreement and PRO royalties. 

We need instrumentals in the following genres: electronica, cinematic/soundtracks, hip hop, pop, roots/country and also melodic sound design with comfortable expressions suitable for documentaries, newsfeeds, tv shows, etc.

Looking forward to receiving high quality mastered instrumental productions!

opportunities.name: Featured Music Review
opportunities.request_description:
Featured Music ReviewOur proposal to you is to create an in-depth writeup on your single, which would be featured on the homepage of our website, a dedicated post on all of our social media (Instagram, Twitter, and Facebook), as well as adding the song to our Spotify playlist.

We encourage you to take a look at our website for examples of all our most recent reviews. At this time, an average article on our website (similar to what we'd be creating for you) receives an average of 20,000 unique readers who are all looking to discover new and upcoming independent artists. We also have a large and engaged following on all of our social media who are looking for the same.- Austin Sher -
Owner - We Write About Music

opportunities.name: Looking for that Somethin' Special
opportunities.request_description:
Looking for that Somethin' SpecialSometimes you hear a song and it hit you right between the ears, it sticks in your head and jumps up at you last thing at night, cleaning the yard, driving your car and you go "Damn that's catchy".

Well with thirty years in the business (Top Ten Writer /  Producer and performer, including writing for the wonderful Gloria Gaynor) I have spotted songs well before they were polished into a hit. My friend played me a rough demo and wasn't sure about it. I nearly fainted, "That's Top Ten my friend" I told him.

I was wrong. It went to Number One in the UK for three weeks!

I hear hits. It's in my DNA. So let me hear what you have and I will give you my brutally honest critique. I will not blow smoke at you. I will tell you what I think and what could be done (if needed) to make it better. 

Obviously if I love it then I will want to talk business with you too but that is for later.

OK the future is yours for the taking.

Musically yours, Tim H

opportunities.name: Get a Professional Song Critique from Steve Tramposch, Platinum A&R, Manager, & Producer
opportunities.request_description:
Get a Professional Song Critique from Steve Tramposch, Platinum A&R, Manager, & Producer

Is your career ready for the next big step? 



If you're looking to get signed and become famous (or even just improve your game), then you owe it to yourself to stop what you're doing right now.



Steve Tramposch has been a Senior A&R exec for some of the world’s largest record and music companies, including Capitol, Virgin, Elektra, Eleven Seven, Billboard, and more.



He’s been doing this for over 20 years, and in that time, he’s been instrumental in the early discovery of artists that have sold tens of millions of records. Rock, Pop, Alternative, Rap, R&B, Singer-Songwriter, Country, Indie, you name it.


He was responsible for signing Nothing More, Red Jumpsuit Apparatus, The Format, and many, many more.


Forget blindly sending in music, waiting on long audition lines, or companies that promise they’ll send it to someone like Steve if they think you’re good enough.



Steve’s going to personally review and send you a professional critique of your song.



On any given day Steve is working with any number of artists fielding offers in a large number of different capacities – record, publishing, TV/film, tours, endorsements, you name it.


When you submit your music, send as much information as possible including links to social profiles, lyrics, social stats, touring stats, etc. 



A few notes: Audio quality is not a deciding factor, talent is. For music, singing a cover is ok if you cannot record and submit an original.


Thanks for visiting, click "Submit to this Opportunity" and let's get started. 


Hope to hear from you, see you inside.

opportunities.name: Get discovered and developed by Launchpad Media & Steve Tramposch (Platinum Manager, A&R & Producer)
opportunities.request_description:
Is your career ready for the next big step? Get discovered and developed by Launchpad Media & Steve Tramposch (Platinum Manager, A&R & Producer)
Is your career ready for the next big step? 


Launchpad Media & Steve Tramposch (Platinum Manager, A&R & Producer) are seeking Artists, Songwriters & Producers for artist development consideration. 

If you're looking to get signed, develop your craft, find a manager, become famous (or even just improve your game), then you owe it to yourself to stop what you're doing right now.



Steve Tramposch has been a Senior A&R exec for some of the world’s largest record and music companies, including Capitol, Virgin, Elektra, Eleven Seven, Billboard, and more.



He’s been doing this for over 20 years, and in that time, he’s been instrumental in the early discovery of artists that have sold tens of millions of records. Rock, Pop, Alternative, Rap, R&B, Singer-Songwriter, Country, Indie, you name it.


He was responsible for signing Nothing More, Red Jumpsuit Apparatus, The Format, and many, many more, and you can be next.


Forget blindly sending in music, waiting on long audition lines, or companies that promise they’ll send it to someone like Steve if they think you’re good enough.



Steve’s going to personally listen to all music submitted, and if chosen, work with you and give you the FAST TRACK ROUTE to achieving your dreams.



On any given day Steve is working with any number of artists and companies fielding offers in a large number of different capacities – record, publishing, TV/film, tours, endorsements, you name it.



If Steve selects your music, he will contact you directly. Keep in mind that moving forward will most likely require payment of additional fees. There are no guarantees but Steve's track record speaks for itself and is worth your investment.



When you submit your music, send as much information as possible including links to social profiles, lyrics, social stats, touring stats, etc.


Thanks for visiting, click "Submit to this Opportunity" and let's get started. 

Hope to hear from you, see you inside.

opportunities.name: Vinyl & Gold Submissions
opportunities.request_description:
Vinyl & Gold SubmissionsAre you an emerging artist or producer with a growing fanbase that you've built on your own? Look no further! Vinyl & Gold is excited to announce our new Listening Dropbox, designed to discover and connect talented artists and producers for representation and collaboration.

We're on the hunt for exceptional artists, particularly in the rap/hip-hop genre, who are ready to take their careers to the next level. Our label has a successful history of sync placements with Netflix, and we're eager to continue expanding our roster of talent. We also love finding fresh, innovative producers to collaborate with our artists and help them create the next big hit.

With established relationships in the industry, our team at Vinyl & Gold is well-positioned to introduce you to top record executives or even represent you directly. If your song catches our attention, it may be pitched to Netflix's blanket music libraries for potential use in upcoming TV shows or feature films.

But that's not all! We're committed to supporting artists beyond the Listening Dropbox. Our website offers a wealth of FREE resources designed to help you grow and refine your craft. At Vinyl & Gold, we take pride in discovering, nurturing, and sharing the talent of tomorrow's top artists.

Don't miss this incredible opportunity to showcase your music and potentially kick-start your career. Submit your tracks to our Listening Dropbox today, and let Vinyl & Gold be your gateway to success in the music industry!- Vinyl & Gold Records -
Record Label - Vinyl & Gold Inc.

Thousands of dollars on offer – Rare sync roster placement from One Night Stand MusicThis is an ultra-rare opportunity for ongoing placements AND a (sync) roster placement with One Night Stand Music and Media.

Due to the amount of ongoing work we have, for the first time ever, we are expanding One Night Stand Music and Media to include a sync roster.

Payments generally range from $1,000 to $5,000 plus.

If you want sync representation, access to exclusive opps and extremely well paid placements, then we would love to consider you for the new roster.

Before submitting, please check out exactly what’s involved at http://www.onenightstand.tv/music/service/ 

After that, please send us your very best music and we will let you know if we can take you on for representation.

Given we work with movie companies, ad agencies, networks, video game companies and more, we require music in absolutely all genres for ongoing consideration / placements. And more than ever, even if we have heard a track before and selected or passed on it, THIS is absolutely the opp to re-submit to.

So, tracks can be….

Alternative, Blues, Childrens Music, Christian & Gospel, Classical, Comedy, Country, Dance, Easy Listening, Electronic, Folk, Hip-Hop, Holiday, Indie, Industrial, Instrumental, Jazz, Latin, Metal, New Age, Pop, R&B/Soul, Rap, Reggae, Rock, and World. Tracks with vocals (of course) as well as instrumentals. 

Again payments generally range from $1,000 to $5,000 plus. I truly believe this will be a great foot up the ladder for any artist.

Last date for submissions to potentially get yourself included on the One Night Stand Music and Media (sync) Roster is the 23rd of December 2021.

- Stuart Cheese / One Night Stand Music and Media / Concerto-XL

opportunities.name: Spooky, Scary, Sci Fi, Fantasy Style Songs
opportunities.request_description:
Spooky, Scary, Sci Fi, Fantasy Style SongsLooking For Scary, Spooky, Sci Fi Music for TV Shows, and Films.  Professional Sound Only! 

Networks such as Sony Pictures, FOX, CBS, NBC Universal, ABC, Lions Gate, Paramount, Warner Bros, etc. We have a "Huge" track record of placing music with these entities! We have music in "King Of Staten Island", "Once Upon In Hollywood",  "Shape Of Water" and 1000's of more Major Films and TV Shows!!  Join the Music Of The Sea Revolution!

Look Up Our Credits in the ending credits of these films~!  IMDB!

If you sign with Music Of The Sea your music will be part of NBC/UNI, CBS Television, Vice, Omnicom system networks upon signing with us. We have deals with these Major Networks. You have a chance to also score shows with us! We have done a ton of custom work!   


Because of the "High Profile Major Artists" in our catalog such as Beyonce, Janet Jackson, Chaka Khan, Bill Withers, Chic, Ojays, Sunshine Anderson, Dionne Farris, Kool and The Gang, etc, they are looking to use the "Music Of The Sea" brand and artist!

We have the attention of many major networks and they want to use the artist and composers from our catalog! Have your song/tracks along ride along side the major artist in our catalog and grow your brand!!! "High Quality" tracks only, no exceptions! No Demos and unmastered tracks, no uncleared samples. You must have clean versions available, and you must own master and publishing rights! Huge opportunity!

If you have music in our catalog, your music is automatically being considered.

- Eddie Sea / Music Of The Sea

Why the higher than average submission fee?

Often we hear music that doesn’t make the final cut for a particular opportunity but we go ahead and select the song anyway because we believe the song is appropriate for other opportunities we’re working on. Here at Music of The Sea, we fill dozens of sync requests every week. We don’t have time to listen to everything so the higher submission fee tends to discourage all but the best - and we sign a lot of music and we place almost all of it.

We only offer one deal and the terms are the same for everyone, so don’t submit if you’re seeking another type of deal. If we select your song, you give us exclusive rights to the song for 3 years. If after three years we haven’t licensed your song, the rights revert back to you. If we do license your song, we share in the revenue. Often, if we love the song we hear and want to work with you we will also have interest in hearing other songs in your catalog and possibly doing a broader deal.

The songs should have an adventurous feel, a sense of movement and development. It would be perfect if there are surprising twists in the arrangement, prominent build-ups and breakdowns. We are open to both vocal and instrumental compositions.

-  Gesaffelstein - Pursuit

-  Goldfrapp - Strict Machine

-  Jon Hopkins - Singularity

-  The Chemical Brothers - Hey Boy Hey Girl

Please submit only professionally recorded and mastered songs. The best submissions will be included in our catalog for licensing which is available to our network of contacts in the film, TV and advertising industry.

As an added bonus, if your song is Selected, we will offer to release your music on Filter Label. The songs by our talented artists can be heard in The OA, Exatlon, The Matrix Revisited, CSI: Las Vegas, Nikita, on ads for McDonald's, Nestle Wagner, Nike, Philip Morris, Hachette Filipacchi, in shows on MTV, CNN, Bravo, Nat Geo, NBC, Esquire, Channel 4 and almost every major TV network in the world.- Emil Hadji -Panzov Founder / CEO - Filter Label

opportunities.name: "How to build a successful band" Career Coaching
opportunities.request_description:
"How to build a successful band" Career CoachingReggie Calloway, Grammy-nominated, multi platinum former leader of Midnight Star, this month answers questions and discusses, "How to build a successful band"The five time Grammy-nominated Reggie Calloway has always displayed a unique ear for music and trends. It is no surprise that the music pioneer received a Grammy nomination for R&B Songwriter of the Year for the hit song “Casanova” in 1987. 

Best known as the founder and leader of one of the most popular Techno-funk bands, Midnight Star, Calloway led the group to international success by writing, producing and arranging a string of top mega #1 hits including, “Operator,” “No Parking On The Dance Floor,” “I Wanna Be Rich” and “Freak-a-zoid.” 

One of Calloway’s original compositions entitled, “I’ll Be Good For You,” was featured on N’Sync’s multi-platinum CD, No Strings Attached (highest selling album of the last decade). He has also penned songs for the chart-topping group Levert (“Casanova”), the sultry Teddy Pendergrass (“Joy”), Grammy-winning Gladys Knight (“Love Overboard”) and “Jump Start My Love” for Natalie Cole.

opportunities.name: Artists only please: Detailed Evaluation & Review
opportunities.request_description:
Artists only please: Detailed Evaluation & ReviewArtists Only: Detailed Evaluation & Review
If your passion is to entertain and edify people with your talent, this is your opportunity to be heard. We are looking for artists with exceptional, recognizable voices and styles to sign to our artist development company. Your ability to write your own songs is a plus but not a necessity.
Please give us a detailed description of your performing experience, artists with whom you identify and who have influenced you, known artist(s) for whom you could open, and the amount of touring you would be able to do based on your relationships and/or job. If you would like us to hear complete songs, submit them, or if you'd rather give us a taste of some different songs, you can submit a show reel medley not longer than five minutes. For every submission, we'll open a conversation with you so we can go further than just a critique of the submission. That conversation will stay open until we've given you every observation and piece of advice we can think of. We won't mince words, so be prepared to get an extremely detailed and honest evaluation of your talent, including what we think your strengths and weaknesses are and what we believe your chances of making it as an artist would be. A small percentage of artists rise to the top. If you aspire to be in that number, let us hear from you. This opportunity is somewhat higher in price than the average opportunity on Xray because we will take the time to deeply evaluate your songs, videos and links. We can't guarantee that we will be able to work with you, but at the minimum, you'll benefit from our 50 years experience in the music industry.- Warren Ells -
Owner - SeaSoDeep Music and SeaBeyondShore Music ASCAP

opportunities.name: "Cortez Farris - Grammy-nominated Audio Engineer & Record Producer (worked with Jay-Z, Mariah Carey, Alicia Keys) - Submit Your Music for a Professional Critique!"
opportunities.request_description:
"Cortez Farris - Grammy-nominated Audio Engineer & Record Producer (worked with Jay-Z, Mariah Carey, Alicia Keys) - Submit Your Music for a Professional Critique!"As an experienced audio engineer and record producer, I am offering detailed critiques of submitted music tracks. I will provide honest and constructive feedback on your music, including elements such as composition, arrangement, production, and mixing. My aim is to help you improve your music and take it to the next level.

In my critiques, I will highlight the strengths of your track and suggest areas that need improvement, including advice on how to enhance the sonic quality of your recording. I have worked with a wide range of music genres, from pop to hip-hop, rock to R&B, and more, so I have a broad understanding of what makes a great track in various styles.

Upon completion of the critique, any fees charged will appear in your account, and you will receive a detailed written critique. Seeking mainstream Dance Pop Songs to pitch for Multiple TV & Film NetworksSeeking mainstream Dance Pop, songs in the style of Katy Perry, Rhianna, David Guetta, Swedish House Mafia, etc, to pitch for Multiple TV and Film. On networks such as FOX, CBS, NBC Universal, Weinstein Co, etc.  Advertisements such as Sony Playstation, Pepsi, Starbucks, Nissan, Gillette, Toyota, tons more,etc.  We have a "Huge" track record of placing music with these entities!

Because of the "High Profile Major Artists" in our catalog such as Beyonce, Janet Jackson, Chaka Khan, Bill Withers, Chic, Ojays, Sunshine Anderson, Dionne Farris, Kool and The Gang, etc, they are looking to use the "Music Of The Sea" brand and artist!

We have the attention of many major networks and they want to use the artist and composers from our catalog! Have your song/tracks along ride along side the major artist in our catalog and grow your brand!!! "High Quality" tracks only, no exceptions! No Demos and unmastered tracks, no uncleared samples. You must have clean versions available, and you must own master and publishing rights! Huge opportunity!

If you have music in our catalog, your music is automatically being considered.

- Eddie Sea / Music Of The Sea

opportunities.name: Seeking Cover Songs, Public Domain Songs, and remakes for Film Trailers and Advertisements
opportunities.request_description:
Seeking Cover Songs, Public Domain Songs, and remakes for Film Trailers and AdvertisementsWe need Cover songs, public domain, and remake songs for Trailers and Advertisements such as Sony Playstation, Pepsi, Starbucks, Nissan, Gillette, Toyota, tons more,etc. We have a "Huge" track record of placing music with these entities! 

Because of the "High Profile Major Artists" in our catalog such as Beyonce, Janet Jackson, Chaka Khan, Bill Withers, Chic, Ojays, Sunshine Anderson, Dionne Farris, Kool and The Gang, etc, they are looking to use the "Music Of The Sea" brand and artist! 

We have the attention of many major networks and they want to use the artist and composers from our catalog! Have your song/tracks along ride along side the major artist in our catalog and grow your brand!!! "High Quality" tracks only, no exceptions! No Demos and unmastered tracks, no uncleared samples. You must have clean versions available, and you must own master and publishing rights! Huge opportunity! 

If you have music in our catalog, your music is automatically being considered. 

- Eddie Sea / Music Of The Sea 

Why the higher than average submission fee?
Often we hear music that doesn’t make the final cut for a particular opportunity but we go ahead and select the song anyway because we believe the song is appropriate for other opportunities we’re working on. Here at Music of The Sea, we fill dozens of sync requests every week. We don’t have time to listen to everything so the higher submission fee tends to discourage all but the best - and we sign a lot of music and we place almost all of it. 

We only offer one deal and the terms are the same for everyone, so don’t submit if you’re seeking another type of deal. If we select your song, you give us exclusive rights to the song for 3 years. If after three years we haven’t licensed your song, the rights revert back to you. If we do license your song, we share in the revenue. Often, if we love the song we hear and want to work with you we will also have interest in hearing other songs in your catalog and possibly doing a broader deal.

opportunities.name: Real Disco Music, 70's 80's for tons of TV Shows!
opportunities.request_description:
Real Disco Music, 70's 80's for tons of TV Shows!Looking For Disco Music in the Style Of Donna Summer, Bee Gees, etc, for TV Shows, and Films.  Professional Sound Only! 

Networks such as Sony Pictures, FOX, CBS, NBC Universal, ABC, Lions Gate, Paramount, Warner Bros, etc. We have a "Huge" track record of placing music with these entities! We have music in "King Of Staten Island", "Once Upon In Hollywood",  "Shape Of Water" and 1000's of more Major Films and TV Shows!!  Join the Music Of The Sea Revolution!

Look Up Our Credits in the ending credits of these films~!  IMDB!

If you sign with Music Of The Sea your music will be part of NBC/UNI, CBS Television, Vice, Omnicom system networks upon signing with us. We have deals with these Major Networks. You have a chance to also score shows with us! We have done a ton of custom work!   


Because of the "High Profile Major Artists" in our catalog such as Beyonce, Janet Jackson, Chaka Khan, Bill Withers, Chic, Ojays, Sunshine Anderson, Dionne Farris, Kool and The Gang, etc, they are looking to use the "Music Of The Sea" brand and artist!

We have the attention of many major networks and they want to use the artist and composers from our catalog! Have your song/tracks along ride along side the major artist in our catalog and grow your brand!!! "High Quality" tracks only, no exceptions! No Demos and unmastered tracks, no uncleared samples. You must have clean versions available, and you must own master and publishing rights! Huge opportunity!

If you have music in our catalog, your music is automatically being considered.

- Eddie Sea / Music Of The Sea

Why the higher than average submission fee?

Often we hear music that doesn’t make the final cut for a particular opportunity but we go ahead and select the song anyway because we believe the song is appropriate for other opportunities we’re working on. Here at Music of The Sea, we fill dozens of sync requests every week. We don’t have time to listen to everything so the higher submission fee tends to discourage all but the best - and we sign a lot of music and we place almost all of it.

We only offer one deal and the terms are the same for everyone, so don’t submit if you’re seeking another type of deal. If we select your song, you give us exclusive rights to the song for 3 years. If after three years we haven’t licensed your song, the rights revert back to you. If we do license your song, we share in the revenue. Often, if we love the song we hear and want to work with you we will also have interest in hearing other songs in your catalog and possibly doing a broader deal.

opportunities.name: Seeking Lo-Fi - Gritty - Acoustic/Electric- Uplifting and Positive
opportunities.request_description:
Seeking Lo-Fi - Gritty - Acoustic/Electric- Uplifting and Positive
Pop-Up Music are looking for gritty organic lo-fi acoustic and full-on electric tracks that are (in the main) uplifting (we understand - most lo-fi may not be uplifting, however a lyric or a cheeky chord sequence can pull things up) , inspiring and positive, tell a story emotionally, have a strong hook/chorus. 
Songs about excitement, new beginnings, fresh start, big life, can't wait, good times, life is good, life is a journey, be strong, be brave, take care of yourself, take care of your family/loved ones, growing up, kids, magical experiences, etc. 
Demos (within reason - its about the vibe) and unreleased are welcome, lo fi is what we need - as reference tracks (for the acoustic) - think Tallest Man on Earth, Said The Whale, Dan Griffin, early Iron and Wine type of lo fi.

This opportunity is for an exclusive contract with a term - all submissions must be 100% owned by the writer/writers. 

We look forward to your submissions. 

Thanks the Pop-Up Music Team!

opportunities.name: Seeking Optimistic Songs for Licensing Placements
opportunities.request_description:
Seeking Optimistic Songs for Licensing PlacementsWe have noticed a repeating trend in the music requests we receive from our partners in the advertising world and therefor we would like to enrich our catalog with more positive, optimistic and stimulating songs. 

The genre is not really important as long as the song has a bright, uplifting feel and the tempo is medium to high. Possible lyrical directions could be: We can do it, On top of the world, Winning, Don’t give up, The best, The time of my life, Unbeatable, Life is good, So happy etc.

Please submit only professionally recorded and mastered songs. The best submissions will be included in our catalog for licensing which is available to our network of contacts in the film, TV and advertising industry.

As an added bonus, if your song is Selected, we will offer to release your music on Filter Label. The songs by our talented artists can be heard in The OA, Exatlon, The Matrix Revisited, CSI: Las Vegas, Nikita, on ads for McDonald's, Nestle Wagner, Nike, Philip Morris, Hachette Filipacchi, in shows on MTV, CNN, Bravo, Nat Geo, NBC, Esquire, Channel 4 and almost every major TV network in the world.- Emil Hadji -Panzov Founder / CEO - Filter Label

opportunities.name: Alt Rock needed for film placement
opportunities.request_description:
Alt Rock needed for film placementWe are in need of Alt Rock tracks for a film placement.  If you have some amazing tracks and songs in this genre, send them over!  Preferably looking for full songs with either male or female vocals or both.  Songs can be about any subject matter as long as they aren't so specific that their use would be limited.  For instance, if lyrics talk about a specific year or event in pop culture or history or mention being in a specific city or country, that may limit our ability to use the song.
We are looking for great Hard Rock Anthems for pitching to CBS Sports and Fox Sports for the upcoming NFL season.  Songs should be current sounding and compare to leading artists and songs in the genre.

If we think your submission may fit, we will place it on hold for further review by the entire team working on this project.  If it is selected, we will contact you further with details. 

Please keep in mind that this is a “submission-only” dropbox.  We are looking for the perfect song for this pitch.  We will not be giving detailed feedback on submissions.  Either we feel the song may fit the brief or it doesn’t.  We apologize for not being able to give feedback beyond whether it fits or not, but the time constraints of the nature of these projects will not allow us the time to give in-depth feedback on the song.  We will, however, submit ratings on every submission.Incorporated Elements is a company that works with songwriters, artists, producers, and DJ's to help them perfect their craft and fully realize the potential in their art. We work in the areas of production, publishing, film/TV licensing, artist development.- Ric Robbins / Incorporated Elements
